**Here’s everything you need to know about how to watch Channel 4’s
investigation into Cambridge Analytica, the data firm that** **may have been a
significant driving force behind** **Donald Trump’s election win and the
pro-** **Brexit vote. Here’s how to watch Channel 4’s Cambridge Analytica
Uncovered online.**

Cambridge Analytica, a data analytics firm that promises to “change audience
behavior”, has found itself at the centre of a controversy about its role in
both the Brexit vote and the 2016 American elections.

A new investigative report produced by Channel 4 has shed uncomfortable light
on the company’s practices, alongside articles
[published](https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2018/mar/17/facebook-
cambridge-analytica-kogan-data-algorithm) by _The Guardian_ and _Observer_.
Cambridge Analytica had
[reportedly](https://www.ft.com/content/7ed1572c-2aa4-11e8-a34a-7e7563b0b0f4)
trying to stop the segment from going out, but it aired as planned on Monday
19 March.

At the centre of the controversy are questions surrounding the amount of
Facebook user data the firm had access to, the methods by which it acquired
this data, and whether Russia had any part to play in its work.

Want to bring yourself up to speed? You can watch Channel 4’s Cambridge
Analytica Uncovered right here with us at _Trusted Reviews._

**Related:[How to delete Facebook](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/how-to-

## How to watch the Cambridge Analytica Channel 4 report online

The investigation was broadcast at 7pm on Channel 4 during the channel’s
regular news hour on Monday 19 March and is now available to watch on catch-up
via YouTube. We’ve embedded it below for your convenience.
